communityResearch.title: Community Research Approach
communityResearch.description: Our lab takes a community-centered approach where students collaborate, share ideas, and learn from each other. Together, they explore real-world questions, build research skills, and create meaningful, collective solutions.

studioTime.title: When You're at Studio Time...
studioTime.description: Our HCI studio time is a collaborative space where students learn by doing. HCI members explore interaction design, user testing, UX, and web development through real-world projects. It's a chance to explore interaction design, try new ideas, learn from failure, and build solutions that solve real needs.
studioTime.imageAlt: HCI Lab members collaborating at Studio Time
studioTime.imageCaption: HCI lab members collaborating at Studio Time

items.title: Leadership
items.description: think critically, collaborate with others, and communicate complex ideas simply.

items.title: Design
items.description: learn to talk large systemic problems with solutions that actually meet people's needs

items.title: Development
items.description: learn to apply AI, ML, Web Dev, and Software Engineering skills on real projects that get used by real people.

alumni.name: Hannah V. Nguyen
alumni.title: UX Designer @ URBN
alumni.quote: Being a part of the Temple HCI Lab gave me a new perspective on user research and design. In the lab, I worked with a talented team on a novel chatbot UI project (Feedstack), which was both fun, challenging, and rewarding! That experience in conversational UI design helped me land my first full-time role as an Analyst & UX Designer at URBN (Urban Outfitters, Inc) for their retail chatbots. I'm so grateful that but most importantly the memories and people I've met at Temple HCI!

alumni.name: Andrew Tran
alumni.title: Software Engineer @ Amazon
alumni.quote: Working on real-world projects helped me build a strong portfolio. The mentorship from Dr. MacNeil and the collaborative environment at the Temple HCI Lab were instrumental in my growth as a developer. The skills and experiences I gained there paved the way for my current role as a Software Engineer at Amazon. I'm thankful for the opportunities and connections I made during my time at the lab.

labHappenings.title: Lab Happenings
labHappenings.description: What began as a small group of six researchers in a modest lab space has grown into a thriving community of over 50 members in just 2–3 years. During this time, our lab has published [insert number] peer-reviewed papers and participated in [insert number] national and international conferences including:

Students collaborating at tables in the HCI Lab studio space
Temple HCI Lab studio session with students at workstations

Attendees at Temple HCI Lab Open House presentation

events.description1:
Our HCI Lab at Temple proudly sponsors OwlHacks, the university's annual hackathon that brings together creative students from all disciplines to design, build, and innovate.

Through this event, we celebrate collaboration, accessibility, and the spirit of human-centered design—empowering students to turn ideas into impactful, user-focused technologies.
events.description2: OwlHacks features panels with Temple alumni now working in the tech and design industry, giving students a chance to learn from real-world experiences and explore diverse career paths in human-centered technology.
